Text: I don't think I need to \n change jobs again.
I-I guess I am, kind of.
That's great.
Hm, sounds complicated. \n Guess I'll just take you \n with me!

And you can't take the 
 picture from the air, 
 it'll just get all 
 blurry.

Go from the fastest 
 blinking light on the 
 left to the slowest on 
 the right.
Perfect! That completes \n the job.
Hey, I think you're \n starting to get used to \n heights now.
We have to get a picture \n with all of the beacons \n lined up horizontally.

I've been taking on more 
 surveying work, and the 
 renewal project is going 
 smoothly.
Okay, all the beacons \n are set, what now?
Endestria's been \n abandoned for too long.
That's nice to hear! \n Keep up the good work.
I want to make sure \n it gets brought back \n to life!
I'd like that too!
N-No, why me!?
I will, for Hekseville!

Thanks for before. I'll 
 never forget the view 
 from the top of 
 Endestria.
Thank you for all of \n your help today.
How's this picture?
What a view... To think \n we all live down there.
Why, oh why, does it \n have to be so far to the \n ground?
So I just need to haul this thing up, right?
Aaah, I can't do it...
Can't do what? \n Are you okay?

I just changed jobs and 
 became a surveyor for 
 the city... Today's my 
 first day.

I'm supposed to survey 
 Endestria as part of a 
 plan to renovate the 
 area.
But I just \n can't do it...

I mean, come on, look at 
 how tall those buildings 
 are! I'm afraid of 
 heights.
Hmm, sounds like maybe \n you should change jobs \n again.

How about I help you 
 out? I can shift 
 gravity, so I'm fine 
 with heights.
That would be perfect, \n thank you!
Can you set these \n beacons up for me?
I'll give you the \n details over the radio.
Grab the Beacon
I've got to take the beacon with me.

Surveyor: \n AAAGH, I'm gonna fall, I know I'm gonna fall!
Don't you worry, I'm a safe flyer!
Surveyor: \n I-I can't do this! Please help me!
Surveyor: \n This should do it.
Surveyor: \n Don't leave me way up here!
Surveyor: \n Pl-Please help me!
Aww, you're making me feel bad about taking you.
I need to finish what I started.
I think it's working... \n I hope this is okay.
That's perfect! Can you \n set the next beacon?
Sure thing!
This isn't hard at all. \n I should be done \n in no time.
The beacon's not \n working...
Strange... They're \n supposed to be \n automatic.
Hold on... I think I \n might know the problem.
It could be because it's \n off balance, or gravity \n wave interference.
Uhh, I don't get it.
What are you doing!?
I figured it'd be faster \n if you came up and took \n a look.
B-But I can't go way up \n there! Put me back down!
If you can't deal with \n heights, you should \n change jobs.
Think of this as a \n chance to conquer \n your fears!
B-But what if they \n conquer me!?
So high... Too high... \n Oh, so very high...
With a fear of heights, \n how can you stand living \n in Hekseville?
It's not easy...
But strange as it \n sounds, I like it here.
I wanted to become a \n surveyor in the first \n place to help this city.
I like that attitude!
So, what next?
This is the last beacon. \n It goes on the top of \n that tower.
Hm?
C-Could you, uh, do this \n one alone?
Come on, let's go!

Surveyor: \n I think I'm gonna be sick.

A place where I can line the beacons up side-by-side, huh...

No, this isn't a good spot.
How about here?
This should be a good place.

The angle's a little steep, I should go up.

I've got to go back and take that picture.
I can't see the lights from this side.
Maybe there's some place lower down?
This place is a little too low.
I can't see the beacons from here.
